result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah Keinard Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 12:00pm on FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 2ND, 2022.
Concurrent to Count 2.

miscConds.notes: No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of firearms.
Maintain full-time employment, school, or combination of both.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by September 7th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1. Huber privileges to apply for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Keinard Williams

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 10 MONTHS - CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 10 MONTHS - CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 12:00pm on FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 2ND, 2022. 

No violations that rise to the level of probable cause. 

Complete 25 hours of community service.

No use or possession of firearms. 

Maintain full-time employment, school, or combination of both.

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by September 7th, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams in court.  Attorney David Bordow in court for Elijah Keinard Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing to proceed.

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams in court.  Attorney David Bordow in court by telephone for Elijah Keinard Williams who appears in person.  Attorney Nate McClure in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Bordow is ill and cannot appear in person. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams in court with attorney David Bordow.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elijah Keinard Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing hearing date. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
ADDENDUM to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams in court with attorney David Bordow.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elijah Keinard Williams appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense counsel has received an offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/29/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams in court with attorney David Bordow.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Elijah Keinard Williams not in court.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/21/22 @ 2p
